moves.11. Bg5 Be7: If Black takes the knight with 11. ...dxc3, 12. Bxf7+ will lead to White winning the undefended queen.
moves.12. Nb5 O-O 13. Ne5 h6 14. Rxf6: The key move, opening up the Black defence.
moves.14... gxf6: If Black captures with the bishop, 14. ...Bxf6, then after 15. Qh5 there is a triple attack on f7, and 15. ...Bxe5 does not work since the bishop is pinned to the queen by the White bishop.
moves.15. Nxf7: 15. Qh5 may also work, but this is a bit more forcing.
moves.16... Qf8: The threat for White is 17. Qg6+, followed by Qxh6+, so Black defends...
moves.17. Bxh6: Unfortunately for Black, though, he is now lost.
moves.17... Qe8 18. Qg6+ Kh8: And now there is a pretty checkmate to finish things off.
